title: Slip on wet concrete - worker returned same day
description: Laborer slipped on freshly washed concrete slab at Tower C level 12 during morning washdown. Minor abrasion on left elbow. First aid applied on site. Worker returned to full duty after treatment.
location: Energy Corridor Tower C - Level 12 Deck

title: Near miss - falling bolt from crane
description: Half-inch bolt dropped from crane hook block during rigging changeover at Resort tower. Bolt landed in barricaded exclusion zone. No workers in area. Crane inspection revealed worn keeper pin.
location: Reid Luxury Resort - Tower Core Floor 28

title: Struck by - pipe from scaffold
description: 6-ft section of 2-inch galvanized pipe fell from scaffold level 4 during plumbing rough-in. Struck ironworker on hard hat and shoulder. Hard hat cracked. Worker experienced shoulder soreness. Sent to occupational clinic. Missed 3 days modified duty.

title: Caught between - excavator and dump truck
description: Spotter failed to maintain safe distance during backfill operations. Operator's leg was briefly pinched between excavator counterweight and dump truck bed. Bruising and swelling. Transported to ER. No fracture. 5 days lost time.
location: Port Container Terminal - Yard Section C

title: Electrical arc flash - switchgear
description: Electrician experienced arc flash while energizing new 480V switchgear at terminal substation. Flash burns on forearms. Safety glasses prevented eye injury. Transported to burn center. 12 days lost time. Full recovery.

title: Heat exhaustion - concrete pour
description: Two concrete finishers showed signs of heat exhaustion during continuous 14-hour summer pour at Museum Park Tower A mat slab. Both treated with IV fluids on site. One transported to hospital for observation. Both returned next week.
location: Museum Park Residences - Tower A Foundation

title: Fall from ladder - 8 ft
description: Painter fell from 8-ft A-frame ladder when top step gave way. Landed on concrete floor. Fractured left wrist and bruised ribs. Transported to hospital. 28 days lost time. Ladder found to have cracked side rail.

title: Near miss - crane overload alarm
description: Liebherr LTM 1100 crane triggered overload alarm while picking steel column at Tower C. Operator immediately stopped lift and lowered load. Investigation found wind speed exceeded chart limits. No damage or injury.

title: Laceration - sheet metal edge
description: HVAC installer sustained 4-inch laceration on right forearm from exposed sheet metal duct edge during installation. Required 8 stitches at urgent care. Returned to modified duty same day.
location: Sugar Land Town Square - Retail Building B

title: Near miss - trench wall slump
description: Utility trench at Hardy Toll Road showed signs of wall movement during lunch break. Competent person evacuated trench. Wall partially collapsed 20 minutes later. No workers in trench. Trench box installed before re-entry.

title: Vehicle accident - pickup truck
description: Company pickup truck rear-ended at red light on site access road. Driver wearing seatbelt sustained minor neck strain. Vehicle drivable. Police report filed. Driver sent to clinic for evaluation. No lost time.

title: Respiratory exposure - welding fumes
description: Welder worked in confined tank without proper ventilation for 45 minutes. Complained of dizziness and nausea. Removed from space and administered oxygen. Transported to clinic. 2 days modified duty.

title: Chemical splash - concrete additive
description: Worker splashed concrete accelerator chemical on face and eyes while mixing. Emergency eyewash used immediately. Transported to ER for evaluation. Minor chemical irritation. Full recovery. No lost time.

title: Crane wire rope failure during load test
description: Main hoist wire rope on Manitowoc 14000 failed during annual load test at 110% capacity. Load dropped 6 inches to test blocks. Exclusion zone was properly maintained. No injuries. Equipment removed from service for full rope replacement.
location: Foster Regional Medical Center - Crane Pad

title: Scaffold collapse - wind event
description: Scaffolding on south face of Museum Park Tower B partially collapsed during unexpected wind gust measured at 62 mph. Scaffold was properly tied but wind exceeded design load. No workers on scaffold at time. Debris fell into barricaded area.
location: Museum Park Residences - Tower B South Face

title: Worker fatality - forklift overturn
description: TRAGIC: Forklift overturned on uneven terrain in container yard during night shift operations. Operator was not wearing seatbelt and was ejected. Pronounced dead at scene. Full OSHA investigation. Operations suspended 72 hours.
location: Port Container Terminal - Yard Section E
